page.title: 02 FARMING
page.content: A typical farm in the Beguildy area is Black House Farm which is owned by Mr. Gilbert Reynolds. It is a farm of 350 acres, 12 acres are used to grow barley,100 acres for hay and silage and the rest is for grazing. Like many other farmers in the area, Mr Reynolds is using more and more fields for the production of silage because this does not depend as much on the weather as hay production. The farm specialises in rearing store cattle and sheep. At present it is also experimenting in the breeding of barley bulls. These are Friesian bulls reared inside and fed on barley and proteins to produce white beef. Farmers in this area are making increasing use of two and three wheeled motorcycles for inspecting and moving stock in distant fields. Some farmers use CB radio for contact with the farm when working on distant hills
